Dialogue: Look, Reese, I didn't ask for this honor and I don't want it. Any of it.

Speaker: reese
Dialogue: John gave me a message for you.  Made me memorize it. 'Sarah"...this is the message... 'Sarah, thank you.  For your courage through the dark years. I can't help you with what you must soon face, except to tell you that the future is not set... there is no such thing as Fate, but what we make for ourselves by our own will.  You must be stronger than you imagine you can be.  You must survive, or I will never exist.'  That's all.

Speaker: reese
Dialogue: Good field-dressing.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: You like it?  It's my first.

Speaker: reese
Dialogue: Sleep.  It'll be light soon.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Okay.  Talk some more.

Speaker: reese
Dialogue: About what?

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: About where you're from.

Speaker: reese
Dialogue: Alright.  You stay down by day, but at night you can move around. The H-K's use infra-red so you still have to watch out. But they're not too bright. John taught us ways to dust them them.  That's when the infiltra- tors started to appear.  The Terminators were the newest, the worst...

Speaker: sentry
Dialogue: Terminator!

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: I was dreaming about dogs.

Speaker: reese
Dialogue: We used them to spot Terminators.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Your world...it's pretty terrifying.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Put that away.  I'll get one.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: This works...really.

Speaker: driver
Dialogue: ...and when it breaks right off the point they get some pretty rad tubes up there. Not awesome, but I mean, worth the drive, if you're hardcore like me.

Speaker: reese
Dialogue: Rad tubes?

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: He's a surfer.

Speaker: driver
Dialogue: You from back East of something?

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: No, he's from the future.

Speaker: driver
Dialogue: Whoah.  I hear that.  Listen, I had a rough night.  I gotta stop and bag some Z's.

Speaker: driver
Dialogue: You can still ride if you wanna hang out for a couple hours.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Thanks.

Speaker: reese
Dialogue: Bag some Z's?

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Let's get cleaned up, Kyle.

Speaker: reese
Dialogue: Yours is over there.

Speaker: reese
Dialogue: Aren't you afraid to be out in the open like this?

Speaker: little girl
Dialogue: Huh?

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: ...I know, Mom.  This is the soonest I could...I know. Mom...Mom, I can't talk long. No, I'm okay.  I'm okay, really.  Listen, I want you to pack some stuff and go up to the cabin for a few days.  Just don't...no, don't ask any questions. Just do it.  I gotta get going...gotta go.  Bye, bye.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Thanks a lot.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: That's where we're going.

Speaker: reese
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Look.  I found it.  Isn't that it?  Cyber Dynamics Corporation?

Speaker: reese
Dialogue: What about it?

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Didn't you say that they're going to develop this revolutionary new thing...

Speaker: reese
Dialogue: Molecular-memory.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Whatever...they become the hotshot computer guys so they get the job to build El Computer Grande...Skynet...for the government.  Right?

Speaker: reese
Dialogue: That's the way it was told to me.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Well, we're gonna uninvent the bastard.  Eighty-six it.  We'll blow up the place...burn it down.  Something.

Speaker: reese
Dialogue: Tactically dangerous.  We lay low.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Reese.  Think it through. We can prevent the war. Nobody else is gonna do it. If we go to anybody official we wind up back in jail and then that walking cuisinart has got us again.  We have to so it ourselves.

Speaker: reese
Dialogue: That's not my mission.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Listen.  Understand.  I'm not a military objective, Reese.  I'm a person... You don't own me.

Speaker: reese
Dialogue: Let's go.  Time to move out.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Fuck you!  Let go of me!

Speaker: reese
Dialogue: Sarah!

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Let...go...bastard...

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Oh, that's real smart. Go on, shoot me. That's brilliant.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Jesus Christ, Reese.  Can't you see I'm scared?

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: I can't spend my life waiting for that thing to catch up with me...always looking over my shoulder, wondering if I left some tiny clue behind...

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Reese?

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Kyle?

Speaker: reese
Dialogue: I'm wrong here.  I wasn't meant to see this...

Speaker: reese
Dialogue: It's...like some dream. This...this...

Speaker: reese
Dialogue: ...and you...all so...beauti- ful.  It hurts, Sarah.  More than death.

Speaker: reese
Dialogue: Don't you understand...it's all gone!

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: We can change it, Kyle.  We have to try.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: There's no fate but what we make for ourselves. Right? Come on.  Let's go, kiddo. Whaddya say?

Speaker: man
Dialogue: Hey, buddy, you got a dead cat in there of what?

Speaker: terminator
Dialogue: Fuck you, asshole.

Speaker: reese
Dialogue: Is this enough?

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Yes.  And I don't want to know where you got it.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: We need a room...with a kitchen.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: I'm dying for a shower.  You could use one too.  And we'd better check that bandage.

Speaker: reese
Dialogue: Later.  I'm going out for materiel.  Keep this.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: ...No, Mom, I can't tell you where I am.  I was told not to say.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Okay, here's the number.  Are you ready?

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Let's see.  Corn syrup. Ammonia.  Moth balls... Mmm.  What's for dinner?

Speaker: reese
Dialogue: Plastique.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: What's that?

Speaker: reese
Dialogue: Nitroglycerin, basically. Bit more stable.  I learned howto make it when I was a kid.

Speaker: reese
Dialogue: Make sure there's none on the threads, like this.  Now screw the end-cap on...very gently.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: You must have had a fun child- hood.

Speaker: reese
Dialogue: That's good.  Now, seven more like that while I make fuses.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: I was thinking, there's so much I've got to show you when we get through this. It's mind boggling, the pos- sibilities...Disneyland, the beach, movies...matinees with popcorn and foot-long hot dogs...

Speaker: reese
Dialogue: Hot dogs?

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: I want to buy you a hot dog so bad,Kyle...all the things you've never seen and done.  You're here, but wherever you go, and whatever you touch, you bring the war with you.

Speaker: reese
Dialogue: My whole life has been combat.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: I want it to be over for you.

Speaker: reese
Dialogue: Not possible.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: I want it to be over for me too. I feel like I slipped over some invisible line, that I'm in your world now.  Everything's the same, but I see it differently. It's like, there's you and me, and him...but nobody else can understand or help or even touch us.

Speaker: reese
Dialogue: We'll head out at 0200. That gives you four hours to sleep if you want.  I'll finish.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: He'll find us, won't he?

Speaker: reese
Dialogue: Probably.  Sarah, if I get zeroed...

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Don't say that.

Speaker: reese
Dialogue: If I do, you have to get away, disappear without a trace. Different country, different name, everything.  In case they send another one.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: It'll never be over, will it? Look at me, I'm shaking. Some legend, huh?  You must be pretty disappointed.

Speaker: reese
Dialogue: No.  I'm not.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Kyle, the women in your time...what were they like?

Speaker: reese
Dialogue: Good fighters.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: That's not what I meant. Was there someone special?

Speaker: reese
Dialogue: Someone?

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: A girl.  You know.

Speaker: reese
Dialogue: Never.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: I'm sorry.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: So much pain.

Speaker: reese
Dialogue: Pain can be controlled. You disconnect it.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: And so you feel nothing.

Speaker: reese
Dialogue: It's better that way.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Oh, Kyle.

Speaker: reese
Dialogue: John Connor gave me a picture of you once.  I never knew why.  It was very old. Torn. Faded.  You were young, like you are now.  You weren't smiling...just a little sad... I always wondered what you were thinking at that second.

Speaker: reese
Dialogue: I memorized every line, every curve...

Speaker: reese
Dialogue: Sarah, I came across time for you.  I love you. I always have.

Speaker: reese
Dialogue: I'm sorry.  I shouldn't have said...

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Kyle...

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: I bet you're ticklish.

Speaker: reese
Dialogue: Ticklish?

Speaker: reese
Dialogue: What are you doing?

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: You'll beg for mercy in a second.

Speaker: reese
Dialogue: I don't think I like this.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: You're not supposed to.

Speaker: reese
Dialogue: Listen to the dogs.

Speaker: reese
Dialogue: Light it now.

Speaker: rider
Dialogue: Don't try to move, buddy.

Speaker: reese
Dialogue: Switch places with me.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Kyle...oh God...

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Alriiight!

Speaker: partner
Dialogue: Don't stop.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Come on, come on, come on ...run, you...

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Hold on real tight, okay?

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Hold on, goddamnit!

Speaker: reese
Dialogue: Sarah.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: We did it, Kyle.  We got it.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: What are you doing?

Speaker: reese
Dialogue: Cover...our footsteps...

Speaker: reese
Dialogue: Leave me here.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: I'm not leaving you anywhere you jerk.  Haven't you figured it out?  Kyle, John is our son.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: There isn't going to be anybody else...I don't want anybody else.  Listen to me!

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Move!  Reese! Let's go. Move you ass!

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Come on!

Speaker: reese
Dialogue: Run!

Speaker: reese
Dialogue: Run, damn it!

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: You're...terminated...fucker!

Speaker: cop
Dialogue: Look, I told you not to touch anything until we're done.  You got that?

Speaker: manager
Dialogue: Sure thing, officer.

Speaker: assistant
Dialogue: What is it?

Speaker: manager
Dialogue: Microcomputer chassis.  But I've never seen stuff like this anywhere.

Speaker: assistant
Dialogue: Weird.  Jap stuff, maybe?

Speaker: manager
Dialogue: Keep it out of sight and get it down to R and D Monday, first thing.

Speaker: assistant
Dialogue: Good idea.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Should I tell you about your father?  That's a tough one. Will it change your decision to send him here...knowing? But if you don't send Kyle, you could never be.  God, you can go crazy thinking about all this...I suppose I'll tell you...I owe him that. And maybe it'll be enough if you know that in the few hours we had together we loved a lifetime's worth...

Speaker: attendant
Dialogue: He says you are very beautiful, Senora, and he is ashamed to ask five American dollars for this picture, but if he does not, his father will beat him.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: That's a pretty good hustle, kid.  Four.  Quatro.

Speaker: attendant
Dialogue: Mil trescientos...fifteen dollars American.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: What did he say?

Speaker: attendant
Dialogue: There is a storm coming in.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: I know.
